intro: Euphrasia jaubertiana, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euphrasia jaubertiana is often found in open habitats and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
